locations.name: New Bark Town
locations.description: A town where the wind blows and tells of impending change.

locations.name: Cherrygrove City
locations.description: A city where you can smell small flowers and a sea breeze.

locations.name: Violet City
locations.description: This old village is still surrounded by trees and other scenery.

locations.name: Azalea Town
locations.description: A town where people and Pokémon live together in simple harmony.

locations.name: Goldenrod City
locations.description: A developing city where people and Pokémon come and go as they like.

locations.name: Ecruteak City
locations.description: A city that even now bears the marks of its history.

locations.name: Olivine City
locations.description: A city where you can hear the melody of the sea.

locations.name: Cianwood City
locations.description: A beachside city that has benefitted greatly from the sea.

locations.name: Mahogany Town
locations.description: A town with a suspicious air to it. It's a hiding place for ninjas.

locations.name: Blackthorn City
locations.description: A mysterious mountain village cut into a rock face.

locations.name: Safari Zone Gate
locations.description: A place where you can experience wild thrills safely.

locations.name: Frontier Access
locations.description: A place where people from all over come to show off their strength.

locations.name: Route 29
locations.description: A road that begins a journey. The road smells like freshly cut grass.

locations.name: Route 30
locations.description: A grassy path where you can battle other young Trainers.

locations.name: Route 31
locations.description: A short, nostalgic path winding through nature.

locations.name: Route 32
locations.description: A path crossed by the Magnet Train bridge--nature meets technology.

locations.name: Route 33
locations.description: A grassy path where you can battle other young Trainers.

locations.name: Route 34
locations.description: A lush, green path, even though it's right next to a city.

locations.name: Route 35
locations.description: A bright path with a lake that's easy on the eyes and easy to traverse.

locations.name: Route 36
locations.description: A green and densely overgrown path that forks in two directions.

locations.name: Route 37
locations.description: A popular route for Trainers, marked by three Apricorn trees.

locations.name: Route 38
locations.description: A path that weaves through trees and comes out at a farm.

locations.name: Route 39
locations.description: A downhill path that passes through a grassy and breezy plain.

locations.name: Route 40
locations.description: You can hear the waves on this path from west Olivine City to the sea.

locations.name: Route 41
locations.description: A rough spot in the sea where whirlpools block your path.

locations.name: Route 42
locations.description: A small path opened at the base of challenging Mt. Mortar with multiple entrances to it.

locations.name: Route 43
locations.description: A woodland path that comes out at a lake. Beware the greedy gate.

locations.name: Route 44
locations.description: A wonderful path with a few pleasant springs and abundant greenery.

locations.name: Route 45
locations.description: A winding road by a river, but called "Mountain Road."

locations.name: Route 46
locations.description: A way home that runs from the base of the mountains to the plains.

locations.name: Route 47
locations.description: A road on a cliff that strikes fear in the hearts of those who dare to pass.

locations.name: Route 48
locations.description: A pleasant path from the base of the mountain to the Safari Zone.

locations.name: Dark Cave
locations.description: A dark, difficult-to-navigate tunnel that runs beneath the Johto region.

locations.name: Sprout Tower
locations.description: A tower where they study diligently to learn to live with Pokémon.

locations.name: Ruins of Alph
locations.description: A place where you can find a former adventure.

locations.name: Union Cave
locations.description: Deep underground, it's connected to the ocean. The water flows here.

locations.name: Slowpoke Well
locations.description: When Slowpoke are thirsty, they come here to drink.

locations.name: Ilex Forest
locations.description: A large forest full of trees that are used to make charcoal.

locations.name: Goldenrod Radio Tower
locations.description: The Radio Tower in Goldenrod City broadcasts numerous programs daily, the most prominent of such being Professor Oak's Pokémon Talk and Buena's Password.

locations.name: Global Terminal
locations.description: Also known as the Global Trade Station, or GTS for short. Here Trainers can access the Global Trade System, a worldwide network over which Trainers from all over the world can trade Pokémon.

locations.name: Goldenrod Tunnel
locations.description: A shopping district stretching below Goldenrod City. The shops that are open in the Tunnel depend on the days of the week and, in some cases, the time of day.

locations.name: Magnet Train
locations.description: A maglev that runs between Johto's Goldenrod City and Kanto's Saffron City. It allows rapid travel between the two cities, moving at over 340 miles per hour (over 550 kilometers per hour).

locations.name: National Park
locations.description: A spacious and beautiful park. It's connected to the Pokéathlon Dome.

locations.name: Pokéathlon Dome
locations.description: A place where Pokémon can compete against each other's strengths.

locations.name: Bell Tower
locations.description: A tower that's said to have a legendary Pokémon that lands there.

locations.name: Bellchime Trail
locations.description: A path said to always be bathed in sunset, no matter what the season.

locations.name: Burned Tower
locations.description: A tower that was hit by lightning, and subsequently caught fire and burned.

locations.name: Moomoo Farm
locations.description: A small farm located on Route 39. Its slogan is: "Enjoy Our Fresh and Tasty Milk". The farm keeps Miltank that produce popular milk for humans and Pokémon.

locations.name: Glitter Lighthouse
locations.description: It shines brightly over the ocean with the power of Ampharos.

locations.name: Battle Frontier
locations.description: A place where people from all over come to show off their strength.

locations.name: Cliff Edge Gate
locations.description: This small cavern is the gateway to the newly-constructed Safari Zone, just west of Cianwood City. An information desk for the Safari Zone can be found here, alongside a giant poster promoting the Safari Zone.

locations.name: Cliff Cave
locations.description: A small cave in the cliffs of Route 47 that offers Trainers access to Route 48 and the Safari Zone.

locations.name: Embedded Tower
locations.description: An enormously tall tower built by people who came from the Hoenn region. Its peak was said to touch the sky, and part of it was embedded into the cliffs of Route 47, running deep underground into the ocean— thus connecting the land, the sea, and the sky.

locations.name: Safari Zone
locations.description: A special Pokémon preserve where Trainers can capture certain types of Pokémon. It is located at the Safari Zone Gate, a bazaar that sprung up due to the Safari Zone's popularity. It is owned by Baoba, the owner of the Kanto Safari Zone.

locations.name: Whirl Islands
locations.description: Four islands that are protected by whirlpools and are difficult to reach.

locations.name: Mt. Mortar
locations.description: A naturally large cavern that is incredibly spacious.

locations.name: Lake of Rage
locations.description: A huge lake full of clear, blue water.

locations.name: Team Rocket HQ
locations.description: "Just a Souvenir Shop" in Mahogany Town.

locations.name: Ice Path
locations.description: A cave that connects Route 44 to Blackthorn City.

locations.name: Dragon's Den
locations.description: A flooded cavern underneath Blackthorn City. The Master can be found here, inside the Dragon Shrine.

locations.name: S.S. Aqua
locations.description: A boat that traverses ocean paths using hydraulic power.

locations.name: Mt. Silver
locations.description: A hallowed mountain that rises between the Johto and Kanto regions.

locations.name: Sinjoh Ruins
locations.description: A snow-covered area of old legends, surrounded by a wall of snow.
